page.title: 09Barkestone dairy farming
page.content: Nowadays it is possible for 160 cows to be milked single handed at one milking and this is all due to present day technology.Most farms have automatic rotary parlours .It is possible for 14 cows to be milked at once being fed their cake automatically and being released after milking.In order to produce a good amout of milk the cows need correct feeding .In summer they need plenty of green grass and protein and in winter they eat silage which has been produced in summer and also cow cake.Each cow on overage produces 4 gallons of milk per day.Their milk is used in many different ways including the making of cheese,cream,yoghurt and butter.
